author: TerrorOfTalos

text: +Ternaldius This song sounds a lot more DKC-like. Stickerbrush Symphony is really melodious and has a great lead line. This song has some really awesome varied percussion and bass, but SS has its own unique rhythmic qualities, which are expressed primarily through the octaves in the bass. Neither one of them is really better than the other. I happen to like this one more by chance, but I wouldn't say there's anything putting it above Stickerbrush Symphony in a musical sense.

text: @pcred566¬†Well, I never said it was objectively better. Just that I like it more, so...

"new DKC soundtrack maybe hit or miss"

I'm sure songs like this one will come off well if the guy who composed for Metroid Prime is on it, but I doubt he'd do other tracks right.  There's nothing very concrete on the subject.  If it is the guy from Metroid Prime, we might see some good composing or mixing that wasn't expected.  That's my thoughts, anyway.

text: This game is in my top five 2D sidescrolling platformers with Yoshi's Island and DKC1.  My expectations are EXTREMELY high for Donkey Kong Country Returns.  I wish all fans the best.  Oh yeah, it was also a frequent rental of mine back in the 90s.

author: Mausiknausi

text:
Donkey Kong Country is back on Wii! With Retro behind the revival, I'm not afraid at all. I just hope they hired David Wise (could it be the reason he recently left Rare to become a freelancer?), maybe even Eveline Fischer as well.

What an E3 for Nintendo, one of the best conferences I've seen over the years. Zelda Skyward Sword, DKC, Kirby, and of course the 3DS. There's even a 3DS remake of Ocarina of Time! And a new Paper Mario too... I could go on and on.
author: SupraDarky
